alert.note: Alert for Paulding (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 19 at 10:06AM EST until February 20 at 11:10AM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Ohio... Indiana... Auglaize River near Fort Jennings affecting Allen OH, Paulding and Putnam Counties. Maumee River at Napoleon affecting Henry County. Saint Joseph River Ohio near St. Joe River Ft. Wayne affecting Allen IN County. Saint Marys River at St. Mary`s River near Fort Wayne affecting Allen IN County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Ohio... Maumee River at Fort Wayne affecting Allen IN and Paulding Counties. Saint Joseph River Ohio below Montpelier affecting Williams County. Saint Joseph River Ohio near Newville affecting Allen IN, De Kalb and Defiance Counties. Tiffin River at Stryker affecting Fulton OH, Williams and Defiance Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Maumee River at Fort Wayne. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Flooding occurs in parks and farmland in Allen County. Unprotected lowland and county roads become affected by flood waters. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM EST Saturday the stage was 17.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM EST Saturday was 17.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this morning and continue falling to 12.0 feet Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
